unnormalised: Okay, here's my take on a Quora post about mental health apps:
normalised: **Mental Health Apps: Are they really helping, yes? (Lifestyle and Wellness)**

unnormalised: **Mental Health Apps: Are they really helping, ya? (Lifestyle & Wellness)**
normalised: Okay guys, so like, everyone's talking about mental health apps these days. Especially after that whole lockdown situation, right? Even my cousin Priya in Mumbai uses one – something to do with meditation, I think.

unnormalised: Okay guys, so like, everyone's talking about mental health apps these days. Especially after that whole lockdown situation, right? Even my cousin Priya in Mumbai uses one – something to do with meditation, I think.
normalised: But seriously, do these apps actually work? I mean, can a bunch of algorithms really understand what's going on inside our heads? I've been seeing ads for apps promising everything from anxiety relief to improved sleep (like the one Doctor Sharma recommends, I think).

unnormalised: But seriously, do these apps actually work? I mean, can a bunch of algorithms really understand what’s going on inside our heads? I've been seeing ads for apps promising everything from anxiety relief to improved sleep (like the one Dr. Sharma recommends, I think).
normalised: I guess for some people, they might offer a little bit of help. Maybe just having a structured meditation session can be useful. Plus, a lot of them are cheaper than going to see a therapist in person, especially if you live in a Tier two city like Lucknow where options are limited.

unnormalised: I guess for some people, they might offer a little bit of help. Maybe just having a structured meditation session can be useful. Plus, a lot of them are cheaper than going to see a therapist in person, especially if you live in a Tier 2 city like Lucknow where options are limited.
normalised: But I'm also a bit skeptical. I mean, can an app really replace the human connection and tailored advice you get from a proper therapist? What about confidentiality? Where is your data actually going?! Is it safe, especially with all the data breach things happening around the globe.

unnormalised: But I'm also a bit skeptical. I mean, can an app really replace the human connection and tailored advice you get from a proper therapist? What about confidentiality? Where is your data actually going?! Is it safe, especially with all the data breach things happening around the globe.
normalised: Has anyone here actually had a *really* positive experience with a mental health app? Share your stories! What app did you use, and how did it help? I'm thinking of trying one, but I want to hear from people who've actually used them and can give an honest review before I commit, especially if it asks for rupee five hundred per month!

unnormalised: Has anyone here actually had a *really* positive experience with a mental health app? Share your stories! What app did you use, and how did it help? I'm thinking of trying one, but I want to hear from people who’ve actually used them and can give an honest review before I commit, especially if it asks for Rs. 500/month!
normalised: Also, are there any apps developed specifically for Indian needs? I'm curious about culturally relevant options. And finally, how does your app affect data consumption --I can't afford to add to my already bursting five gigabyte per day limit!

unnormalised: Also, are there any apps developed specifically for Indian needs? I'm curious about culturally relevant options. And finally, how does your app affect data consumption --I can't afford to add to my already bursting 5GB/day limit!
